title: 820-01598 bootloop
message:
Board have liquid damage around R6900, U6903, Q8401.

No chime, trackpad clicks, no caps lock LED.
Got 20V on charger and after 15 seconds take 0.15A and reboot. 

Readings from board only.
PPDCIN_G3H = 20V
PPBUS_G3H = 12.7V
PP3v3_G3H = 3.30V
PP1V8_SLPS2R = 1.79V
PP1V8_AWAKE = 1.79V
P3V3MAIN_PGOOD = 3.25V
PP3V_G3H_RTC = 3V
P5VG3S_EN = 1.79V
PP5V_G3S = 5.10V
PMU_PVDDMAIN_EN =3.30V

Any idea?

title: 820-01598 bootloop
message: Yes, tried 'Restore' but failed with error 6.

title: 820-01598 bootloop
message:
Both USB ports have the same behavior?
Do you get SSD voltages?
Voltage appears on the big coils?

title: 820-01598 bootloop
message:
Same issue on both USB port on source Mac. On target Mac it is detected only on one port which is nearer to trackpad (thats as it should)

SSD/NAND voltage:
PP3V3_G3H_SSD0 = 3.3V
SSD_PMU_RESET_L = 1.8V
PPVCCQ_ANI_SSD0 = 1.8V
PP0V9_SSD0 = 0.9V
SSD0_VR_P2V5_EN = 1.8V
PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 = 2.5V
SSD0_OCARINA_WP_L = 0V
SSD0_OCARINA_RESET_L = 0V

No voltage on big coils.

Used thermal camera and thats what I got (rest of the board is cold):

title: 820-01598 bootloop
message: If no important data on its SSD, try DFU restore.

title: 820-01598 bootloop
message: Probably leakage from backlight area to some data lines happened...

title: 820-01598 bootloop
message:
Found short on PPVCC_S0_CPU (0.001V in diode mode).
Injected low voltage and on thermal camera only part of CPU went warm so thats it I think.
